title: Nano Banana Pro
author: meetpateltech
aiHeadline: Google's latest innovation: a tiny banana-shaped gadget that somehow manages to be both underwhelming and overpriced, because why not?

title: CBP is monitoring US drivers and detaining those with suspicious travel patterns
author: jjwiseman
aiHeadline: CBP is now watching your every move on the road, because nothing says 'freedom' like being pulled over for having a 'suspicious' route on your GPS.

title: Microsoft makes Zork open-source
author: tabletcorry
aiHeadline: Microsoft finally does the world a favor by open-sourcing Zork, because who doesn't want to relive the glory days of text-based adventure gaming with a modern twist of irony?

title: Android and iPhone users can now share files, starting with the Pixel 10
author: abraham
aiHeadline: Android and iPhone users can now share files, but don't get too excitedâ€”this feature still somehow manages to feel like a consolation prize in the ongoing smartphone wars.

title: Red Alert 2 in web browser
author: nsoonhui
aiHeadline: Red Alert 2 is now playable in your browser, proving once again that nostalgia is the only thing that can make a 20-year-old game feel like cutting-edge technology.
